item.title: GOP VP hopefuls in Congress burnish their credentials while currying favor with Trump
item.dc:creator: Sahil Kapur
item.description: Potential picks are using the opportunities afforded to them in Congress to burnish their credentials to appeal to Trump.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump points during a rally
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump at a campaign rally in Freeland, Mich., on May 1, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Elise Stefanik during a press conference at the U.S. Capitol
media:content.media:description: Rep. Elise Stefanik, R-N.Y., gained national attention after grilling college presidents during a hearing.

media:content.media:text: Tim Scott at the Family Leadership Summit in Des Moines, Iowa
media:content.media:description: Sen. Tim Scott, R-S.C., is widely seen as a potential VP pick for Trump.

media:content.media:text: J.D Vance at the U.S. Capitol Building
media:content.media:description: Sen. J.D. Vance, R-Ohio, said he wouldn’t have certified the election for Biden in 2020.

item.title: Trump, gun owners and Jan. 6 rioters: Tough-on-crime Justice Alito displays empathy for some criminal defendants
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Hurley
item.description: Conservative Justice Samuel Alito, a former U.S. attorney with a long history of voting in favor of prosecutors, has shown signs of empathy for defendants.

media:content.media:text: Associate Justice Samuel Alito in Washington, DC. on April 23, 2021.
media:content.media:description: Justice Samuel Alito in 2021.

item.title: Blinken says U.S. is not avoiding holding Israel accountable: ‘We don’t have double standards’
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken joins Meet the Press to discuss the recent State Department report on Israel’s actions in Gaza.

media:content.media:title: Blinken says U.S. is not avoiding holding Israel accountable: ‘We don’t have double standards’
media:content.media:description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken joins Meet the Press to discuss the recent State Department report on Israel’s actions in Gaza.

item.title: Battles rage across Gaza as death toll tops 35,000 and tens of thousands evacuate Rafah
item.dc:creator: Hala Gorani and Mithil Aggarwal
item.description: Battles between Israeli forces and Hamas across Gaza after thousands people heeded evacuation orders to seek shelter elsewhere in the enclave.

media:content.media:text: Displaced Palestinians evacuate along a road of rubble
media:content.media:description: Displaced Palestinians evacuate from the Tal al-Zaatar camp for Palestinian refugees in Gaza on May 11, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Smoke rises above damaged buildings
media:content.media:description: Smoke rises above buildings during an early morning Israeli strike on Rafah, Gaza, on Saturday.

media:content.media:text: Palestinian civilians flee Rafah in southern Gaza
media:content.media:description: Displaced Palestinians transport their belongings on the back of a truck as they move to a safer area in Rafah, Gaza, on Thursday.

media:content.media:text: A Palestinian wounded in the Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip
media:content.media:description: A Palestinian wounded in the Israeli bombardment of the Gaza Strip is brought to a hospital in Rafah, Gaza, on Tuesday.

item.title: Stress, confusion and uncertainty as borrowers navigate Biden debt relief plans
item.dc:creator: Shannon Pettypiece and Peter Nicholas
item.description: When student loan repayments began last October, Rachel Grace was faced with a painful financial choice: start making payments or drop her health insurance coverage.

media:content.media:text: Supreme Courts Rules On Major LGBTQ Case And Strikes Down Biden's Student Loan Forgiveness Plan
media:content.media:description: Student debt relief advocates stand outside the Supreme Court on June 30, 2023.

item.title: Northern lights visible across U.S., even reaching the deep south, due to solar storm
item.description: Dazzling colors lit up the night sky over the United States as the aurora borealis was visible as far south as Florida and even possibly Hawaii. NBC News’ George Solis speaks with a planetarium director to learn more about what’s causing the spectacle in the sky.

media:content.media:title: Northern lights visible across U.S., even reaching the deep south, due to solar storm
media:content.media:description: Dazzling colors lit up the night sky over the United States as the aurora borealis was visible as far south as Florida and even possibly Hawaii. NBC News’ George Solis speaks with a planetarium director to learn more about what’s causing the spectacle in the sky.

item.title: Nic Fink, balancing Olympics dreams with a 9-to-5 job, eyes gold in Paris
item.dc:creator: Daniel Arkin
item.description: Olympic athletes often juggle competing demands, but few have mastered the art of multitasking quite like Nic Fink, a swimmer on the U.S. national team.

media:content.media:text: Nic Fink competes in the Men's 200m Breaststroke prelims on Day 4 of the TYR Pro Swim Series San Antonio at Northside Swim Center on April 13, 2024 in San Antonio, Texas.
media:content.media:description: Nic Fink competes in the men's 200 meters breaststroke prelims on Day 4 of the TYR Pro Swim Series San Antonio on April 13.

media:content.media:text: Nic Fink points to his muscles
media:content.media:description: Nic Fink celebrates after winning the gold medal in the swimming 100m Breaststroke Men Final during the World Aquatics Championships in Doha, Qatar, on Feb 12.

media:content.media:text: Nic Fink sings the national anthem
media:content.media:description: Gold Medalist Nic Fink during the national anthem at the Medal Ceremony after the Men's 100m Breaststroke Final at the World Aquatics Championships in Doha, Qatar, on Feb 12

item.title: On Mother’s Day, aunties deserve their flowers, too
item.dc:creator: Nicole Acevedo and Char Adams and Kimmy Yam and Jo Yurcaba
item.description: Ahead of Mother’s Day 2024, NBC News asked people across the country to share how having an auntie — or being one — has shaped their lives.

media:content.media:text: Leila Register
Roselyn Dana, who shared a wedding dance with her aunt Carmen Santini, says her aunt helped improve her relationship with her mother.
media:content.media:description: Roselyn Dana, who shared a wedding dance with her aunt Carmen Santini, says her aunt helped improve her relationship with her mother.

item.title: In China, poker is out, while ‘throwing eggs’ is in
item.dc:creator: Cheng Cheng and Larissa Gao
item.description: As American investors pull funds out of China, local financiers are focusing on finding business domestically, and learning a Chinese card game that might help.

media:content.media:text: Guandan is a poker game originated in Huai 'an, where the game is played by four people in pairs.
media:content.media:description: Players competing in the final of a guandan competition in China’s Jiangsu province last year.

item.title: In the mystery of Florida’s bizarre spinning fish, a leading suspect has emerged
item.dc:creator: Evan Bush
item.description: A mysterious ailment causing fish in the Florida Keys to spin in circles and die has touched off a race to find the cause and save the endangered sawfish.

media:content.media:text: A sawfish sticks it's head out of the water
media:content.media:description: A sawfish in Islamorada, Fla., in 2015.

item.title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: Sound and Fury
item.description: When the wife of a popular Atlanta DJ is found murdered in their home, investigators try to unravel what happened. Stephanie Gosk reports Friday, May 10, at 9/8c on NBC.

media:content.media:title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: Sound and Fury
media:content.media:description: When the wife of a popular Atlanta DJ is found murdered in their home, investigators try to unravel what happened. Stephanie Gosk reports Friday, May 10, at 9/8c on NBC.

item.title: Thousands of civilians flee northeast Ukraine as Russia presses a renewed border assault
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Thousands more civilians have fled Russia’s renewed ground offensive in Ukraine’s northeast that has targeted towns and villages with a barrage of artillery and mortar fire, officials said Sunday.

media:content.media:text: Khrystyna Pyimak hugs her mother Oksana Velychko
media:content.media:description: Khrystyna Pyimak, 11, hugs her mother Oksana Velychko, 42, after evacuation from Vovchansk, Ukraine, on Sunday.

media:content.media:text: People sit in a bus
media:content.media:description: A bus of evacuees from Vovchansk, Ukraine, on Sunday.

item.title: Idaho doctor with love of adventure dies in avalanche he apparently triggered while skiing
item.dc:creator: Doha Madani
item.description: An Idaho emergency room doctor who connected adventure-seeking to acts of altruism died on Friday in an avalanche that he apparently triggered while skiing.

media:content.media:text: The peak of a snowy mountain
media:content.media:description: Donaldson Peak in Idaho’s Lost River Range.

item.title: Apple’s Maryland store workers vote to authorize strike
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: Workers at Apple’s store in Towson, Maryland, have voted in favor of authorizing a strike, the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers (AIM) said in a statement late on Saturday.

media:content.media:text: People walk by the Apple store
media:content.media:description: An Apple store at Brand Shopping Center in Glendale, Calif., in 2023.

item.title: Magnitude-6.4 earthquake strike rattles Mexico-Guatemala border
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: TAPACHULA, Mexico — A strong earthquake shook the border of Mexico and Guatemala early Sunday, driving frightened residents into the streets.

media:content.media:text: Migrants cross through the Mexico-Guatemala border
media:content.media:description: Migrants arrive to El Ceibo, Guatemala through the Mexico-Guatemala border on Aug. 19, 2021.

item.title: Canadian police announce the arrest of a fourth Indian suspect in the killing of a Sikh activist
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: A fourth Indian national living in Canada has been charged in the slaying of a Sikh separatist leader last June that became the center of a diplomatic spat with India.

media:content.media:text: Sikh community members hold Canadian flags and signs
media:content.media:description: Members of British Columbia's Sikh community gather in front of the courthouse in Surrey, British Columbia, on Tuesday.

item.title: Spain watches closely as Catalans take separatist movement to the ballot
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Catalonia is holding a regional election on Sunday whose outcome will reverberate in Spain’s national politics.

media:content.media:text: Two voters submit their ballots in a ballot box
media:content.media:description: Voters submit their ballots at the Universitat de Barcelona on Sunday.

item.title: Sen. Lindsey Graham says Israel should do 'whatever' it has to, comparing the war in Gaza to WWII

item.title: Secretary of State Antony Blinken declines to identify 'red line' for aid to Israel
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Marquez
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday declined to identify the Biden administration’s “red line” with Israel, despite President Joe Biden’s comments earlier this week that the U.S. will withhold certain military assistance if Israel launches an offensive on Rafah.

media:content.media:text: Antony Blinken.

item.title: Many Iranian Jews in ‘Tehrangeles’ say their allegiance is to Israel, not Iran
item.dc:creator: Alicia Victoria Lozano
item.description: As pro-Palestinian protesters clash with counter-protesters at U.S. colleges, among the most vocal defenders of Israel are members of the Iranian-Jewish community.

media:content.media:description: Abby Yosian, right, made a new friend from Israel, Charlotte Korchak, left, at an outdoor Passover seder near the University of Southern California.

item.title: Biden taps Obama, George Clooney, Julia Roberts and the Clintons for mega fundraisers
item.dc:creator: Monica Alba and Mike Memoli
item.description: President Joe Biden’s campaign plans to host a major fundraiser in Los Angeles next month with former President Barack Obama and Hollywood superstars George Clooney and Julia Roberts, according to a campaign official.

media:content.media:text: Joe Biden
media:content.media:description: Joe Biden during a campaign event in Raleigh, N.C., on March 26, 2024.

media:content.media:text: Julia Roberts and George Clooney
media:content.media:description: Julia Roberts and George Clooney arrive for the premiere of "Ticket to Paradise" in Westwood, Calif., on Oct. 17, 2022.
